categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
Patient's Alternative Name Rule
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

issuesList.xmlString: <value xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="419511003" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED-CT" displayName="Propensity to adverse reaction to drug" xsi:type="CD"/>

<value xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="419511003" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED-CT" displayName="Propensity to adverse reaction to drug" xsi:type="CD"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Allergies Concern observation effective times reflect the appropriate allergy concern status
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.description: Each medication needs to have its own Medication Signture Text EntryRelationship and the reference should exist in the same section where you found it

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: All problem codes are should express with core subset of SNOMED codes
Problem Concern effective times reflect the appropriate problem concern status

categoryRubrics.description: A Problem Concern of completed or suspended should have a Problem Concern effectiveTime/high value present.Similarly a Problem Concern which is Active shall not have a Problem Concern effectiveTime/high value.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Smoking status code value should be valid
Smoking status observation Template Id should be valid
